meanings.definition: To package excessively or in excess.
meanings.sent1: She always overpackages her gifts with too much wrapping paper.
meanings.sent2: The company tends to overpackages their products, leading to unnecessary waste.
meanings.sent3: He overpackages his lunch so much that it barely fits in his bag!
meanings.sent4: The chef overpackages the sushi rolls with layers of rice, making them hard to eat.
meanings.sent5: The student overpackages their essay with unnecessary details, making it hard to read.

meanings.definition: Excessive packaging or packaging in excess.
meanings.sent1: The overpackages of the online orders were causing a storage issue.
meanings.sent2: The environmentalist was concerned about the overpackages used in the industry.
meanings.sent3: The pile of overpackages in the corner made the room look cluttered.
meanings.sent4: The overpackages of snacks at the party were untouched by the guests.
meanings.sent5: The overpackages of the new electronics were difficult to recycle.
